content.question: The current in a <math alttext="10 ohm" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> resistor is given as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> by the equation <math alttext="I equals, I naught, times e raised to the negative a times t power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>α</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="I naught equals 4 amperes" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="alpha equals 2 inverse seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following represents the rate of energy dissipation in the resistor at time <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="20 times e to the negative 6 power, watts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="40 times e to the negative 6 power, watts" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mi>e</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>W</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="160 times e to the negative 6 power, watts" overflow="scroll"> <mn>160</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>W</mtext> </math>

<math alttext="40 times e to the negative 12 power, watts" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mi>e</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>12</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>W</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="160 times e to the negative 12 power, watts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>160</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="160 times e to the negative 12 power, watts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>160</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
